metadata.title: CVE-2022-0494 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: A kernel information leak flaw was identified in the scsi_ioctl function indrivers/scsi/scsi_ioctl.c in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a localattacker with a special user privilege (CAP_SYS_ADMIN or CAP_SYS_RAWIO) tocreate issues with confidentiality.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
